pages.text:
About
About Cocoa Beach Main Street
Where Downtown Meets the Ocean
Cocoa Beach Main Street (CBMS) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to revitalizing and promoting Downtown Cocoa Beach as a vibrant, economically strong, and culturally rich destination. Since our designation in 2014 by the State of Florida’s Division of Historical Resources, CBMS has led efforts in economic development, historic preservation, and district-wide improvements.
As a proud member of the
Main Street America
network, CBMS follows a proven four-point approach:
Economic Vitality, Design, Promotion, and Organization.
This framework empowers us to align with both local stakeholders and national leaders to support small business growth, attract investment, and drive sustainable development.
What We Do
Strengthen the Local Economy
through targeted business support, entrepreneurial outreach, and district-wide planning.
Build Partnerships
with small businesses, property owners, civic leaders, and tourism professionals to create a unified vision for the downtown area.
Promote Cultural Events
and unique experiences that attract visitors while enriching the lives of residents.
Enhance Public Spaces
through beautification projects, signage, accessibility improvements, and preservation of the district’s historic charm.
We work hand-in-hand with local and regional leaders to support Cocoa Beach’s identity as both a beachside escape and a thriving economic hub. With every initiative, Cocoa Beach Main Street aims to foster a walkable, livable, and investable community.
Meet the board
Kenne Wells - Executive Director
Born and raised in Lakeland, Florida. Has 1 daughter, and 5 grandchildren.
Cocoa Beach resident since 2010.
Owner/operator of Coastal Market from 2011-2023.
I have always believed that if you love where you live, you should take an active role as part of the community. Give back and help make it better now and for the future.
Cocoa Beach Main Street represents the community and businesses and I am happy to represent this amazing organization.
In my spare time I enjoy family, friends, listening to live music (Mondo Tikis) time at the beach and traveling. Grateful.
Debi Roth
Debi Roth born in Brevard County and is a Broker / CO-Owner of Veterans Realty of Brevard with her Husband Joe also a Native Floridian from Cocoa Beach.
Licensed Realtor in Florida and New York  over 35 years. In her spare time enjoys teaching Water Aerobics,  Acting in our local Theatre "Surfside Playhouse" and volunteering her time and talents with Cocoa Beach Mainstreet.
Joanie Iaco - Vice President
Joanie Iaco has been part of the Cocoa Beach community since 2006, initially as a part-time resident and now proudly living here full-time. A licensed Real Estate Agent with Engel & Völkers, Joanie brings a strong commitment to community involvement and local business support.
With over 15 years of Rotary membership—14 in Bluffton, SC, and now with the Cocoa Beach Rotary—she strongly believes in giving back to the community you live in. As the current Vice President of Cocoa Beach Main Street, Joanie is dedicated to helping local businesses remain vibrant and thrive. Passionate about preserving the charm and vitality of Cocoa Beach, she looks forward to continuing to serve and support the city’s growth and success.
Margret Schneider
Retired in 2018 from MMS Consulting Corp., a real estate development consulting corporation located in Westchester County, NY.  Handled all aspects of residential development for leading real estate developers including all municipal approvals, design, legal, marketing, sales, and management.  Portfolio amounted to approximately $1 billion of condominium, townhome, co-op and single family developments.
Elected to the Common Council for the Village of Dobbs Ferry in early 1980’s and served two terms before retiring from public office.   Introduced Village Administrator form of government and oversaw the interview process, hiring and job responsibilities during first term.  Ran for and won re-election to a second term in order to see this major improvement to local government succeed and it has remained in place for 40 years.
Serves on Garden Bay Condominium Association Board of Directors 2021, 2022 and 2023.
Appointed to City of Cocoa Beach Planning Board March 2022.
Served on a multitude of civic and philanthropic boards including Westchester County Economic Development Council, Mercy College Board of Trustees, Women in Communications Executive Board, New Rochelle Police Advisory Commission, Boys Town of Italy, Go Red for Women, United Way and American Diabetes Association.

Upcoming Events
Oct 25th • Sip-n-Stroll
20 spine-tingling stops serving up bat bites and vampire sips of boutique wines and spirits. Creep, crawl, and scavenge your waythrough downtown, haunting the ghoulishly good shops and wickedly welcoming businesses along the way.
Check-in at the parking lot of your first stop will be Destination Downtown Food Hall, 2 N. Atlantic Av. Look for the white tent in theparking lot.
Be picture ready in your frightful costume.
Check-in begins at 4:45pm and closes promptly at 7pm. Don't be late!,
At check-in you will receive a swag bag, commemorative cup, wristband and a scavenger hunt map to lead you to all the ghoulishstops.
Rain or shine event. No refunds.
Must be 21+ to participate in the event.
Buy Tickets Now
Mark your calendar and don’t miss our upcoming events!

Contact Main Street
How can we help you?
Want to get more involved with Cocoa Beach Main Street? Have a question? Wanting to become a Sponsor? Own a business in Downtown Cocoa Beach?
Fill out this form and and we will get back to you!

Cocoa Beach Main Street Members 2025
We appreciate the continued support of our local Business Partners, and Friends of Cocoa Beach Main Street.
Our Partners
Big Kahuna
(visionary and bold)
Cocoa Beach Explorer
is the Space Coast’s premier lifestyle and tourism magazine, trusted by locals and visitors alike. With dynamic content that captures the spirit of Cocoa Beach—from surf culture and space launches to hidden gems and local legends—
Explorer
connects readers to the best of the area. Its wide distribution, loyal readership, and targeted reach make it the leading local publication for businesses looking to make a lasting impact and see real results.
Learn More
Cocoa Beach
blends a vibrant surf culture, scenic beaches, family-friendly museums, natural beauty, and a front-row seat to America's space heritage. Whether you're here to catch waves, catch wildlife, or catch rocket launch excitement—this laid-back coastal town has it all.
Learn more
BREEZY KAHUNA
(cool and committed)
Learn More
Freshly Squeezed
is a fun, fresh morning show highlighting local businesses and featuring the best of the Space Coast! Join us in discovering the unique stories and the inspirational people behind your favorite places. We love our vibrant community filled with artists, entrepreneurs, and visionaries who make sure we all get to have the best time in our rocket ship backyard!
Tritt Productions
is a creative multimedia agency offering a wide range of services to local clients. Their expertise includes sound reinforcement for small- to medium‑sized events, as well as video production, photography, and graphic design—delivering high-quality visual and audio content tailored to each client's needs.
Learn More
Coastal Kahuna
(solid and local-proud)
320 N Atlantic Ave
Jet Press Printing & Graphics, established in 1962, is a full service commercial print company specializing in helping business’ and organizations get their message out in innovative ways. But it doesn’t stop there, from greeting cards, coloring books, school projects to quick copies, we handle many personal printing and design as well for any type of project or event.
WEBSITE
2 N Atlantic Ave
Destination Downtown Food Hall™ brings the Cocoa Beach community together with bold flavors and local flair—supporting small business owners, showcasing regional culinary talent, and serving up everything from hometown favorites to creative fusion bites.
Website
Everyday Kahunas
(our ride or die partners)
126 N. Atlantic Avenue
Retro Reef Boutique is a charming thrift haven, brimming with unique treasures and vintage vibes. From quirky collectibles to stylish secondhand finds, it’s the go-to spot for one-of-a-kind gems.
Instagram
72 S. Atlantic Ave
We are a high end Jewelry Store Specializing in Diamonds Gold Jewelry and Coins. We Buy & Sell. If You Need anything in Jewelry Or Coins Just Stop on Buy
Facebook
25 N. Orlando Ave
Offering a wide array of swimwear, beach coverups, and accessories sure to mak you stan out.
Website
705 N Atlantic Ave
Your neighborhood hardware store.
Facebook
9 S Atlantic ave
Category 5 is Cocoa Beaches newest hotspot located right next door to Tropics & Hunkerdown Hideaway
Facebook
259 Minutemen Causeway
At Junk Food Bakery in Cocoa Beach, everything is 100% scratch-made with love and quality ingredients—no box mixes, no shortcuts, no shortening. Just real, homemade treats like Grandma used to make… if Grandma had a wild sweet tooth and a knack for bold, unforgettable bakes.
Website
101 N Atlantic Ave
AN OUT OF THIS WORLD EXPERIENCE!
Cosmik Tiki is designed with fun in mind! ​Take a dip in our sparkling swimming pool, enjoy our other-worldly games and activities, and
freshen up in our clean and well-maintained showers and bathrooms. Play amazing arcade games, grab some drinks, snacks, and get ready for an unforgettable Cocoa Beach experience!
Website
1 S Atlantic Ave
Tropics Cocktail Bar on the corner of fun!
Website
231 Minutemen Cswy
The Alibi Cocktails & Bites is an upscale cocktail bar and restaurant specializing in handcrafted cocktails, fine wines, craft beer and chef-driven small plates. The decor pays homage to the golden age of speakeasies and supper clubs with exquisite lighting, luxurious wall coverings and multiple intimate seating areas.
Website
7 S. Atlantic Ave
Hunkerdown Hideaway a local hangout and home of the annual NYE shark drop. Discover a wide beer selection, live music, and bar bites, plus a Bloody Mary breakfast bar.
Facebook
Contact the artist Becki at 321-217-2915
Face painting and body art for all ages. Book her for your special parties and events.
Faceook
For an unforgetable experieince contact Tony @ 321-334-3956
Shrunk3D Space Coast will arrive at your Corporate event, wedding or graduation to capture lasting memories. Providing personalized 3D miniatures of yourself, loved ones or pets. Or come to our studio by appointment in Melbourne, FL.
Facebook
30 N. Brevard Ave
Balanceable is a modern healthcare facility dedicated to balance therapy, chiropractic care, and nutrition counseling. With a focus on balance and mobility, we help individuals of all ages and abilities mitigate the risk of falls, optimize athletic performance, and promote overall health and well-being.
Website
63 N. Orlalndo Ave.
We're 2 sisters on a mission to make Cocoa Beach a healthier place to be. Come join us for a refreshing drink, hang out with some awesome locals, and enjoy this amazing place we get to call home!
Website
70 S. Atlantic Ave
Foxtail Coffee, Cocoa is located just a few blocks from the beach, making grabbing a cold brew and strolling as the sun comes up just another day. Local beers on tap, Kelly's Ice cream ready to be scooped, and a beautiful beach inspired wave mural is perfect for photo ops!
Website
1165 N Highway A1A
With a passion for serving others and a deep understanding of the importance of home, Joanie is here to guide you through your real estate journey with empathy, expertise, and integrity by delivering exceptional service, attention to detail, and meticulous care.
WEBSITE
Walk-In Chiropractic
Salty Gator Bikes
Rick Bond, Realtor
Cosmik Tiki
Shrunk 3D
